intro: Microsaccus sumatranus, commonly known as the Sumatran microsaccus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and climbers. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
